elements.title: axial parallelism (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the axial parallelism (diagram pictured) of the Earth's tilted axis is the reason we have winter, spring, summer and fall?

elements.title: Rick Rehm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rick Rehm attributed his surprise victory in an Alabama election to grassroots campaigning, while his opponent attributed it to straight-ticket voting?

elements.title: village-owned enterprises (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 90 percent of Indonesia's village-owned enterprises are not legal entities, hampering their ability to attract investors or open bank accounts?

elements.title: 2022 edition of the game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that prior to kickoff, the Bahamas Bowl announced that the winner of a regular season game between Miami and Ball State would earn a bid to the 2022 edition of the game?

elements.title: Frederica Planta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Frederica Planta designed cards to teach the children of George III and Queen Charlotte the history of England?

elements.title: Bob (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Weird Al" Yankovic wrote the song "Bob" entirely in palindromes, and sang it in the style of Bob Dylan?

elements.title: Ammonihah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the Book of Mormon, the city of Ammonihah kills Christians by fire as a deliberately twisted reference to a warning that spiritual death is like a "lake of fire and brimstone"?

elements.title: Boudica (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the name of Boudica may have been an honorific title?
